title: Make sure to use the correct .targets name on Linux
body:
This fixes 2 bugs:
 1. The .targets file should have been renamed for the separate packages. 
 2. The `Prefer32Bit` property appears to be ignored on Linux, so in this case we also need to ignore it.

A workaround for bug 1 would be to add this to the bottom of the .csproj:

```xml
<Target Name="AfterBuild">
  <Copy SourceFiles="$(NuGetPackageRoot)skiasharp.nativeassets.linux\1.68.0\runtimes\linux-x64\native\libSkiaSharp.so"
        DestinationFiles="$(TargetDir)libSkiaSharp.so" />
</Target>
```

A workaround for bug 2 would be to add the  `PreferredNativeSkiaSharp` property in the .csproj (making sure to select the correct architecture of the OS):

```xml
<PreferredNativeSkiaSharp>x64</PreferredNativeSkiaSharp>
```
